gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.Cursor
Class WedgeCursor

java.lang.Object
  gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.Cursor.XOR_Cursor3pt
      gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.Cursor.WedgeCursor
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class WedgeCursor
extends XOR_Cursor3pt
implements java.io.Serializable

This class implements a Rubberband Wedge cursor for selecting regions. The wedge can range from a pie slice to a pie without a slice.

See Also:
XOR_Cursor3pt, Serialized Form

Method Detail

draw

public void draw(java.awt.Graphics graphics,
                 java.awt.Point p1,
                 java.awt.Point p2,
                 java.awt.Point p3)
This method draws a wedge or pie slice. First a line is drawn, then the wedge is formed.

Specified by:
draw in class XOR_Cursor3pt
Parameters:
graphics - The graphics context that the circle will be drawn in.
p1 - Vertex of wedge.
p2 - Radius point of the wedge.
p3 - Size of wedge arc.

region

public java.awt.Point[] region()
This method returns an array of points used to define a wedge. p[0] = center pt of circle that arc is taken from p[1] = last mouse point/point at intersection of line and arc p[2] = reflection of p[1] p[3] = top left corner of bounding box around arc's total circle p[4] = bottom right corner of bounding box around arc's circle p[5].x = startangle, the directional vector in degrees p[5].y = degrees covered by arc. p[0-2] are used for drawing lines p[3-4] are needed in case wedge is from an ellipse p[5] is needed to determine which area was selected, wedge or all but wedge

Returns:
array of Points used to define a wedge
